code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @return {Integer}
def minimum_cost(nums)
    n = nums.length
    # dp[i][j] represents the minimum cost to split the array into j subarrays up to index i
    dp = Array.new(n) { Array.new(4, Float::INFINITY) }
    dp[0][1] = nums[0] # Base case: minimum cost to split the first element into 1 subarray

    # Iterate over the array
    (1...n).each do |i|
        # Update the cost for splitting into 1, 2, or 3 subarrays
        (1..3).each do |j|
            # Case 1: Extend the current subarray
            dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j]

            # Case 2: Start a new subarray
            if i > j - 1
                dp[i][j] = [dp[i][j], dp[i - 1][j - 1] + nums[i]].min
            end
        end
    end

    # The answer is the minimum cost to split the entire array into 3 subarrays
    dp[n - 1][3]
end
